intro: Gagnebina microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed gagnebina, is a rare and unique species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, small, rounded leaves. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
